results.title: Adam Smith and The Wealth of Nations
results.creator_credit: John Haggarty, Jean Wadlow, Charles Barker Films and Liberty Fund
results.brief_description: Studies the life and works of Adam Smith, the Scottish political economist and philosopher whose book “The Wealth of Nations” was completed two hundred years ago. Outlines many of Smith’s most interesting and controversial theories.

results.title: Activity group therapy: as developed at the Jewish Board of Guardians
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment of children’s personality disorders through their participation in group activities guided by a permissive adult. Focuses on three boys with different problems: one is over-aggressive, another is withdrawn and latently schizophrenic and the third is introverted and suffering from anxiety hysteria. Their progress is traced through many scenes of group activities, filmed with a hidden camera.

results.title: Action loop
results.creator_credit: Dudley Robinson, Filmpartnership and Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority
results.brief_description: Shows the progress being made in the construction of the underground rail loop in the city of Melbourne. The four tunnels will link five stations at Flinders Street, Parliament, the Museum, Flagstaff and Spencer Street, thus relieving the present strain on the city’s transport system. Although much work is yet to be completed - overhead wiring, retaining walls, rails to be laid - by the early 1980’s, Melbourne will be a modern transport system city. Narrated by Michael Pate. Photographed by Dudley Robinson.

results.title: Action for children's television: kids for sale
results.creator_credit: Yale Marc, Jim Herzig and Cinema Graphics
results.brief_description: Provides an analysis of some of the critical issues concerning children and television. Examines the role of broadcasters and advertisers, with particular reference to the types of programs selected for transmission and the nature of the commercials shown. Finally, viewers are challenged to take an active role in improving children’s television. Suitable for upper secondary, tertiary and teacher levesl.

results.title: Acrobats of God (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dave Wilson, H Poindexter and Martha Graham Centre for Contemporary Dance
results.brief_description: Presents Martha Graham and her company in a dance performance which celebrates the trials, discipline, denials, glories, and delights of a dancer’s world. Choreography by Martha Graham. Music by Carlos Surinach.

results.title: acousma
results.brief_description: It uses as its basis recordings of the electrical activity occuring within my brain during unconsciousness, to create a unique sound composition, a kind of audio representation of my dreams during sleep. This we realised through the use of software to systematically create audio transcriptions of both my EEG (electroencephalography) wave-traces and MRI images into sound, subsequently giving my unconscious mind a voice. The visual element of the piece consists of the entire sequence of MRI scans which were used in creating the soundtrack. These I animated in order that the viewer be taken on a highly unorthodox journey through the human head, as part of the experience

results.title: Acne...it's not your fault
results.brief_description: Outlines the various types of acne suffered by adolescents ranging from a few spots to severe inflamation and indicates the treatment required for each of these stages of acne severity. Stresses that bad acne needs treatment by a medical practitioner.
results.description: Outlines the various types of acne suffered by adolescents ranging from a few spots to severe inflamation and indicates the treatment required for each of these stages of acne severity. Stresses that bad acne needs treatment by a medical practitioner.

results.title: ACMI Presentations
results.brief_description:
John Smithies, CEO of ACMI delivered a series of presentations relating to the opening of ACMI at Federation Square. This is a collection these presentations and materials including:

  1. Power point presentation on 5th September 2002
  2. Original files and movies for power point presentation
  3. ACMI cinepac used at Naming ceremony for Alfred Deakin Building

results.title: Achimota
results.creator_credit: John Page and British Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: Shows the introduction of higher education to West Africa, Nigeria and the Gold Coast in the early part of the 20th century with the establishment of Achimota College, Gold Cast. Emphasises the need for preserving valuable elements of the African culture. Conversely however, ends up reinforcing the dominance of the western way of life over Africans under colonial rule. Commentary by Dr Julian Huxley.
